# NSTextLayoutOrientationProvider

**Protocol**

A set of methods that define the orientation of text for an object.

## Declaration

```swift
protocol NSTextLayoutOrientationProvider
```

## Overview

In macOS, the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/NSTextContainer] and [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/AppKit/NSTextView] classes adopt this protocol; in iOS, only the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/NSTextContainer] class implements it. An [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/NSTextContainer] object returns the value from its associated text view when present; otherwise, it returns [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/NSLayoutManager/TextLayoutOrientation/horizontal] by default. If you define a custom [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/NSTextContainer] object, you can override this method and return [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/NSLayoutManager/TextLayoutOrientation/vertical] to support laying out text vertically.

## Getting layout orientation

- **layoutOrientation**: The default layout orientation.
- **NSLayoutManager.TextLayoutOrientation**: Constants that describe the text layout orientation.

## Layout

- **Using TextKit 2 to interact with text**: Interact with text by managing text selection and inserting custom text elements.
- **Display text with a custom layout**: Lay out text in a custom-shaped container and apply glyph substitutions.
- **NSTextLayoutManager**: The primary class that you use to manage text layout and presentation for custom text displays.
- **NSTextContainer**: A region where text layout occurs.
- **NSTextLayoutFragment**: A class that represents the layout fragment typically corresponding to a rendering surface, such as a layer or view subclass.
- **NSTextLineFragment**: A class that represents a line fragment as a single textual layout and rendering unit inside a text layout fragment.
- **NSTextViewportLayoutController**: Manages the layout process inside the viewport interacting with its delegate.

## Conforming Types

- NSTextContainer
